nodes.name: Crab Shaft Top Door (to Pseudo Plasma Spark)

strats.name: Frozen Sciser
note: The Global crab in the upper section can be knocked off the wall to enter the left side of the above door.
Otherwise, there are more crabs in the lower section of the room.

gModeImmobile.devNote: Requires entering on either side of the doorway, but not in the center.

nodes.devNote: No spawnAt and no junction below, because the door can be entered with just a crouch jump

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Crab Shaft Ice Only Crab Climb
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Climb the frozen crabs Suitless without the help of SpringBall jumps or HiJump.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Suitless Walljump Climb with HiJump
strats.note: Wall jump back and forth up the shaft. It's a really long climb.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This does not require canWaterShineCharge, as you can store the shinecharge before entering the room.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Crab Climb
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Crab Shaft Ice Only Crab Climb
note: Freeze a crab multiple times to climb the upper Crab Shaft.
It may be easier to climb the left shaft by knocking the crab off the wall, or by bringing up a crab from the lower area.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
strats.note: Only requires a runway of approximately 1 tile in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Requires at least 13 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster, Spring Ball
note: Requires running a very precise distance of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to hit a peak in the speed / height relationship.
The spring ball jump is used after landing near the top, to get to the platform below the door.

strats.name: Suitless Water Shinecharge
note: After storing the shinecharge, spin jump back to the left and spark aligned against the right side of the left shaft.
At the top of the room, hold right in order to land on the platform below the door.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Frozen Falling Crab
strats.note: Involves a Super to freeze a crab in midair.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Frozen Crab Steps
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Crab Shaft Ice Only Crab Climb
note: Freeze a crab below the opening, and another one at the ceiling on the lip of the entrance.
Stand on a frozen crab and crouch jump to the one on the ceiling.
When against the top crab, press into it to be pushed up onto it.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Repetitive Walljumps
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Crab Shaft Ice Only Crab Climb
note: Similar to naked watering hole escape.
Freeze a crab under the gap above, do a stationary spinjump facing right, then walljump until you're up.
Another frozen crab can help complete the way up.

strats.name: Get Hit By Yard
strats.devNote: Requires no items or tech if you step on a Snail - canUseEnemies is necessary for G-Mode Setup.

nodes.name: Aqueduct Top Door (to Botwoon Hallway)

strats.name: Snail Platform
strats.note: The two snails together can setup G-Mode on either side of the door.

gModeImmobile.devNote: Requires entry on either side of the doorway, but not the center.

nodes.name: Missile (pink Maridia)
Super Missile (pink Maridia)
Aqueduct Junction (Below Top Door)

enemies.note: They move around the external walls even when offscreen, and can be brought to any of their home nodes.
It circles around on one of the grapple panels.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Snail Climb without movement items by better coordinating the movements of both the snail and Samus.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct Snail Clip
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.
This clip can be used to get to the middle left door and the items in the top right of the room.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph PB
strats.note: Place a PB then exit G-Mode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the PB Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the PB blocks below to overload PLMs, then go up through the crumble blocks to escape, then climb through the Speed blocks.

strats.name: Aqueduct Left-Side X-Ray Climb (Upper)
note: Climb up 1 screen.
Aim to end this XRay climb when Samus is visually near but not above the top of the left side door.
Fall out of the wall by turning to the right, from a crouch if possible.
This XRay climb has a window of 4 crouches, but with a way to break bomb blocks it can be ended earlier.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the PB Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the PB blocks below to overload PLMs, then go up through the crumble blocks to escape.

strats.name: Snail Clip to the Left Middle Door
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.

strats.name: Aqueduct Left-Side X-Ray Climb (Lower)
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Snail Jump
strats.devNote: HJBless SpringBall jumps require less obvious snail positioning.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Crab Shaft Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.

to.devNote: There's nothing difficult about getting here suitless, but it does run a heavy risk of leading the player into suitless Maridia situations

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: A very precise CrouchJumpDownGrab, or springball jumping to the snail is closer to canSnailClimb.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Right Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks
G-Mode Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks
G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items (To the Items)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.
strats.devNote: This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, as it is only worth doing this strat if the items are there.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - PB the Items (To the Items)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.
strats.devNote: This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, as it is only worth doing this strat if the items are there.

to.note: This direct link is just for the shinespark

strats.name: Snail Climb
strats.note: Watch out for snails coming from above, or aggressive snails from below, who will either block or attack Samus.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Top Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.
Watch out for snails coming from above, or aggressive snails from below, who will either block or attack Samus.

strats.name: Snail Clip to the Items
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.

strats.name: Aqueduct Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Aqueduct Snail Stuck Moonfall
note: Use two snails to perform an 'Enemy Stuck Moonfall' to bypass the bomb blocks above the middle left door of Aqueduct.
Position one snail on the above door shell, and the second above the corner of pipe below
Samus will clip through the lower snail, taking damage, then continue through a segment of pipe where the crumble blocks can be reached.
Facing both snails during the moonfall while positioning Samus for the clip can be precise
Depending on the exact heights of the snails, it may be necessary to pose change while clipping.

to.devNote: This link is only for strats that can't go from 9 -> 2 -> 5.

strats.name: Aqueduct Top Door Snailstep
strats.note: Involves waiting around for a snail to come along, in order to reach the door by jumping while standing on it.

strats.name: Aqueduct Top Door Crouch Jump
strats.note: Crouch on the ledge to the left where Samus is mostly hanging off, jump then move over quickly without spin jumping.

nodes.name: Botwoon Hallway Bottom Door (to Aqueduct)
Botwoon Hallway Right Door (to Botwoon)

runways.name: Base Runway - Botwoon Hallway Right Door (to Botwoon)

enemies.note: It's stuck in a prison and you need morph to enter.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Botwoon Hallway Mochtroid Ice Clip
note: Crouch under the crumble blocks while aiming upward, using both angle buttons then freeze the Mochtroid while it is on Samus.
Jump onto the Mochtroid by quickly pressing down after jumping, when on it, press up to stand then jump through the ceiling.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Mochtroid Clip (Left to Right)
note: Crouch under the crumble blocks while aiming upward, using both angle buttons then freeze the Mochtroid while it is on Samus.
Jump onto the Mochtroid by quickly pressing down after jumping, when on it, press up to stand then jump through the ceiling.
With no jump assists, use a frozen Mochtroid as a platform to get to the ledge above the door.

strats.name: CF Clip with Bombs (Left to Right)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far right of the ceiling of the bottom right pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
The vertical positioning can be setup using Gravity and Bombs.

strats.name: Suitless CF Clip (Left to Right)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far right of the ceiling of the bottom right pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
This is for the much harder version, without Gravity and Bombs.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Mochtroid Clip (Right to Left)
note: Crouch under the crumble blocks while aiming upward, using both angle buttons then freeze the Mochtroid while it is on Samus.
Jump onto the Mochtroid by quickly pressing down after jumping, when on it, press up to stand then jump through the ceiling.
With no jump assists, use a frozen Mochtroid as a platform to get to the ledge above the door.

strats.name: CF Clip with Bombs (Right to Left)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far left of the ceiling of the middle left pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
The vertical positioning can be setup using Gravity and Bombs.

strats.name: Suitless CF Clip (Right to Left)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far left of the ceiling of the middle left pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
This is for the much harder version, without Gravity and Bombs.

nodes.name: Botwoon Right Door (to E-Tank)

runways.name: Base Runway - Botwoon Right Door (to E-Tank)

nodes.name: Botwoon 1
Back-Side Botwoon

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight: Gravity, Charge, Wave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
note: With Gravity, dodging the acid is pretty trivial.
Even without knowing about the distance trick expected in the suitless version.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight: Suitless, Charge, Wave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
note: Even when suitless, it's possible to stand far enough that the acid attack doesn't spawn.
Botwoon still gets hit. So there's a safe way to take no damage.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Microwave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: Stand on the appropriate pixel for shooting diagonally through the wall and use the microwave trick to defeat Botwoon.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.
There is not proper spacing for landing an angle down shot and xraying.
Waiting for Botwoon to peak their head through the wall works too but is less safe.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: A charge beam shot will pass right through the dividing wall if fired from the correct 2pixel window.
Using angle down the spot is where Samus' front toe touches the wall.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Plasma Shield Microwave
note: Wait for Botwoon to spawn then use a Plasma Special Beam Attack.
Use XRay to slow time and watch for a particle to overlap Botwoons head, then proceed to Microwave.
unlockStrats.devNote: Killing in 1 SBA takes some luck.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Plasma Shield Fight
unlockStrats.note: Stand near the dividing wall and unleash the Plasma Special Beam Attack!

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Super Only Fight
note: Wait for the one pattern (bottom->right) where Botwoon's head passes through the dividing barrier briefly and fire a Super Missile.
This takes a long time, averaging one super per minute.

nodes.note: This represents fighting Botwoon from behind the wall.

nodes.name: Botwoon 2

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Use Charge and Wave to kill Botwoon from the right, through the wall.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: Stand on a particular two pixels to the right of the dividing wall and fight Botwoon using charge beam shots.
Using angle down the spot is where Samus' front toe touches the wall.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.

strats.name: Suitless Botwoon Kill
note: Fight Botwoon without Gravity suit.
The left corner can be used to avoid most attacks and may be worth using even in the opening of the fight for safety.

strats.note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks. Avoiding the sand pits is easier without Gravity or HiJump.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Direct
strats.note: Be careful not to touch or bomb the sand in order to grab the item before PLMs are overloaded.

strats.name: Botwoon Energy Tank Room Puyo Bomb-Grapple-Jump
note: Lure a Puyo close to the sand and use it to Bomb-Grapple-Jump up to the Morph Ball maze.
It helps to predict the jump pattern of the enemy.

strats.name: Speed Blocks Already Broken With Gravity
Suitless Spark
strats.note: Coming in with zero momentum, all it takes is one non-hjb full height jump forward, then activate.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs
note: Overload PLMs by touching the sand, then move through the speed blocks.
Shoot the Puyo while crouching to increase accuracy.
Avoiding the right pit is much easier without Gravity or HiJump.
Standing on the edge and spin jumping to the left is much easier than a running jump.
While on the left side of this platform, the Puyo to the left will start moving; carefully kill it.

to.devNote: Direct link passing below. Passage above should go 4 -> 6 -> 5 -> 1.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Requires approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, as this is a peak in jump speed.

strats.name: Bomb Grapple Jump
strats.note: Use the respawning Zoas to double jump up to the Morph Ball maze.

bypassStrats.name: Halfie Climb Room Xray Climb Grapple Clip
note: Perform an Xray Climb until you are just above the door into Cacatac Alley.
Walk left into the gap between pipes, behind the grapple blocks.
Walk to the left wall, turn around, crouch, grapple the block and release.
Samus will fall into the door transition.
The camera Does not follow Samus but the pipes are still visually in the same position.  And the camera does not break after the transition.

A Crouch jump makes the SpringBall jump easier, but at the cost of some horizontal movement.

note: Only requires a runway of approximately 1 tile in the adjacent room.

to.devNote: This link is only for the shinespark, mochtroid climbing or cross room jump. Other strats should go 2 -> 1 -> 4.

strats.name: Halfie Climb Carry Shinecharge through Morph Tunnel to the Middle
note: Charge a shinespark below the Oums, near the bottom right door, quickly move through the morph tunnel and spark up left to the middle door.
This is an alternative to wall jumping.
strats.devNote: Jumping into a diagonal spark saves a little energy from both the jump and hitting the slightly lower ceiling by the door.

to.devNote: This link is only for the shinespark. Other strats should go 3 -> 2 -> 1.

strats.name: Halfie Climb Enter with Shinespark from the Bottom Right
note: Quickly shoot out the 3 shot blocks then horizontal spark breaking the speed blocks.
Wait for the Oums to roll on their own to a place where they can be climbed.
Do not stand on the Oums when they begin to attack.

strats.name: Halfie Climb Carry Shinecharge through Morph Tunnel to the Top
note: Charge a shinespark below the Oums, near the bottom right door, quickly move through the morph tunnel and spark up to the top door.
This is an alternative to wall jumping.
strats.devNote: Jumping into a diagonal spark saves a little energy from both the jump and hitting the slightly lower ceiling by the door.

to.devNote: This link is only for the shinespark. Other strats should go 3 -> 2 -> 1 -> 4.

nodes.name: Colosseum Bottom Right Door (to Precious Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Colosseum Bottom Right Door (to Precious Room)

bypassStrats.name: Colosseum Gravity Grapple Clip
note: Crouch and freeze a Mochtroid to clip into the space behind the grapple blocks.
Jump and tap grapple while aiming diagonally to be pushed into the wall just the right amount.
Samus should be one tile below the grapple blocks and fully in the wall.
Too short a tap and the next grapple will not work, too long and Samus will be stuck in the wall.
Grapple diagonally again to be pushed into the transition.

bypassStrats.name: Colosseum Suitless Grapple Clip
note: Freeze a Mochtroid either pixel perfectly or with Morph+XRay to clip into the space behind the grapple blocks.
Jump and tap grapple while aiming diagonally to be pushed into the wall just the right amount.
Samus should be one tile below the grapple blocks and fully in the wall.
Too short a tap and the next grapple will not work, too long and Samus will be stuck in the wall.
Grapple diagonally again to be pushed into the transition.
devNote: FIXME: Investigate how TAS clips behind the grapple blocks from above.
1) with a bomb to make the grapple go to jank 2) by clipping a pixel into the grapple blocks on the left
Both ways swing up through the top blocks by being closer than collision detects.

nodes.name: Colosseum Top Right Door (to Save)

runways.name: Base Runway - Colosseum Top Right Door (to Save)

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Colosseum with no Equipment
note: Cross the Colosseum by using the spikes as platforms to stay out of the water.
Requires some very difficult jumps and excellent control over spike damage knockback.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Colosseum Mochtroid Ice Climb
note: Cross the Colosseum by using the Mochtroids as frozen platforms.
Some Mochtroids need to be led into the water either from the previous section of room or from jumping high in the current section.
Mochtroids are most stable to climb when they are against a wall.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Colosseum Green Door Grapple Clip
note: Use a Mochtroid to clip into the space behind the grapple blocks.
Then use Grapple on the blocks to be pushed a precise amount into the wall above the door.
From there, use grapple again to be pushed diagonally down into the transition behind the Green shell.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: While that one walljump near the end is a bit precise, it does not require a delayed walljump.

strats.name: Space Jump
strats.devNote: No water involved here, so no need for Gravity or canSuitlessMaridia.

strats.name: Suitless Grapple Only
note: Use Grapple Beam to cross the Colosseum. The first two room segments can be safely grappled across from in the water.
The third room segment grapple is tricky. It is possible to use the spikes as platforms instead.

strats.name: Colosseum Spike Platforming with Move Assist (Left to Right)
note: Use the spikes, which are not in the water, to jump from platform to platform as a way to cross the Colosseum.
Requires knowing the position of every spike in the room, and hitting the spikes while morphed can help.
The first jump is particularly tough.  A springball rolling jump, SpringBallJump from the sand with HiJump, or Grapple can be used to get past it.

strats.name: Colosseum with no Equipment (Left to Right)
note: Land on each set of spikes as a way to jump to the next safe platform.
The first jump can be done with a very precise damage boost to bounce forward off the spike, or using morph.
strats.devNote: Positioning on the spikes is harder to control without morph.

strats.name: Colosseum Mochtroid Ice Climb (Left to Right)
note: Climb a mochtroid with ice using the wall to help guide them.
It is very easy to take damage if not careful.
devNote: Mochtroid damage is pretty hard to avoid, but it is possible.
HiJump listed as a safety mostly to counter how easy it is to fall in sand and die without it.
canWalljump is also a safety.  Mochtroid movement and freeze timing gets harder for the jump out of the water.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with IBJ
strats.note: Only requires a runway of approximately one tile in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
strats.note: Barely possible to do with a runway of one tile in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Requires running a very precise distance of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to hit a peak of the speed vs height graph.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Spring Ball
strats.note: Only requires a runway of approximately one tile in the adjacent room.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
note: Immediately when entering the room, turn around to the left while using X-ray and kill the Mochtroid, to prevent or minimize damage.
Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.note: Place bombs without moving horizontally, such that multiple hit the Mochtroid immediately as it attaches without being boosted into the doorway or sand.

strats.name: Space Jump
strats.devNote: No water involved here, so no need for Gravity or canSuitlessMaridia.

strats.name: Colosseum with no Equipment (Right to Left)
note: Stay out of the water, and by extension the sand, of Colosseum by using the spikes as platforms.
Landing on spikes aiming down with no other direction pressed can help contol the knockback.
Requires knowing the position of every spike in the room.
The final spike jump is very difficult.

strats.name: Colosseum Mochtroid Ice Climb (Right to Left)
strats.note: Jump out of the sand to lure down mochtroids to freeze.  Or bring them from the previous section of room.
devNote: Mochtroid damage is pretty hard to avoid, but can be.
HiJump is used to lure down Mochtroids.
canWalljump is a safety.  Mochtroid movement and freeze timing gets harder for the jump out of the water.

nodes.name: Missile (Draygon)

to.note: Since this involves water and failure involves more water, it won't be expected without gravity suit unless suitless is expected.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.note: It takes a bit more time to set up the spark when suitless.

strats.name: Precious Room X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Cross Room HiJumpless Double SpringBall Jump with Bombs
note: Only requires a runway of approximately 0.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
SpringBall jump once on the way up, then use a Bomb to buy just enough time for a second SpringBall jump.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
note: Only requires a runway of approximately 0.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
A momentum conserving turnaround is easier than a midair wiggle.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room.
A momentum conserving turnaround is easier than a midair wiggle.

nodes.name: Draygon

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Grapple Kill
note: Kill Draygon by grappling to the top left turret.
Number of Draygon hits seems to vary, taking a worst case guess at 5.

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Grapple Quick Kill
note: Kill Draygon by grappling to a bottom turret as you get grabbed.
Avoids taking all the hits from Draygon.

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Shinespark Kill
unlockStrats.note: Shinecharge in-room, then horizontally spark through Draygon multiple times.
unlockStrats.devNote: 150 frames is an approximate sum of all required shinesparks.

unlockStrats.name: Suitless Draygon
unlockStrats.note: Fight Draygon without gravity, but with morph.
unlockStrats.devNote: This will require coming into the fight with ammo to kill the turrets. Although that ammo could instead be farmed in the fight.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 2.5 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Down Grab
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 2 tiles in the adjacent room

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Air Ball
strats.note: Requires an air ball and a runway of at least 1.5 tiles in the adjacent room

strats.name: G-Mode Morph (Draygon Alive)
strats.note: There is enough time to IBJ to the top door before Draygon appears.

strats.name: Draygon HiJumpless Speedjump
note: There is a very precise speed where the hjless speedjump is doable.
Starting against the left wall, jump just to the left of the rightmost pipe sticking out of the ground.

strats.name: Suitless shinespark
strats.note: Takes more time to setup than suited. but you can spark from a bit farther out because of the water physics.

strats.name: Draygon Turret Grapple Jump
strats.note: Performing a grapple jump off of a Draygon turret. Usually done by bouncing off the wall for momentum.

nodes.name: Space Jump Room Door (to Draygon)

West Cactus Alley Left Door (to Butterfly Room)

nodes.name: West Cactus Alley Right Door (to East Cactus Alley)

runways.name: Base Runway - West Cactus Alley Right Door (to East Cactus Alley)

strats.name: Gravity Damage Boost
strats.note: Damage boost up to the higher ledge using a Cacatac spike. Spikes only exist on camera so follow a vertically fired spike up to the correct height.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up a little less than 1 screen.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump
strats.note: Requires a runway of approximately 2 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Underwater Walljumps
note: It can be difficult to land on the ledge when the waterline is low.
It may be necessary to time the walljump attempts by watching the water level, or by stalling with additional walljumps as the water rises.

nodes.name: East Cactus Alley Left Door (to West Cactus Alley)

nodes.name: East Cactus Alley Junction (Left of Morph Tunnel)
East Cactus Alley Junction (Top Right)
East Cactus Alley Junction (Bottom Middle)
East Cactus Alley Junction (Right of Morph Tunnel)

enemies.groupName: East Cactus Alley Top Right Cacatacs
East Cactus Alley Top Left Cacatac

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Doesn't require anything, but getting out does.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Diagonal IBJ
note: Hug the right wall after killing the first Cacatac in order to avoid its invisible, stationary projectiles.
After getting to the small island platform, diagonal IBJ up while avoiding the top Cacatac.
Alternatively HBJ to the next platform and Spring Ball from the right edge of this platform into an IBJ above the spikes.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.note: Hug the right wall after killing the first Cacatac in order to avoid its invisible, stationary projectiles.

strats.name: East Cac Alley G-Mode Morph, IBJ, HBJ
strats.note: This requires multiple HBJ to get over spike pits. The first one, by the right door, must be started at the top of an IBJ.

strats.name: Gravity and SpringBall
strats.note: There is just enough distance for a MidAir SpringBall jump to reach without HiJump.

strats.name: Suitless HiJump Space Jump Break Free
note: Use SpaceJump to break out of the water.
Afterward, it's easiest to use a wall jump to gain height but this is not required.

strats.name: Suitless HiJump SpringBall Jump
note: SpringBall jump just as Samus exits the water to reach the distant ledge.
To get enough horizontal distance, either use a Stationary Lateral Mid-Air Morph with a crouch jump for extra height, or spin jump out before morphing.
Or SpringBall jump part of the way over and land on a Bomb explosion to cross the rest of the distance.
strats.devNote: canStationaryLateralMidAirMorph is not strictly required but better describes the difficulty.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Assist
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 1.5 tiles in the adjacent room, although it is easier with more.

strats.name: East Cac Alley Cross Room Jump with IBJ
note: Requires a runway of at least 1.5 tiles in the adjacent room, although it is easier with more.
Start the IBJ as far left as possible. The furthest right is just right of the waterfall.
At the top of the IBJ bomb to the left and unmorph to reset fall speed.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 2 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: East Cac Alley Cross Room Jump with Spring Ball, Bomb Boost
strats.note: Use the bomb boost as Samus is going through the doorway, then spring ball after breaking the water, then ibj or use an unmorph bomb boost.
devNote: This strat requires a minimum of 2 bomb/PBs.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to hit a peak of the speed vs height graph.
Spring ball can be used with the speed to get all the way to 3, but it's tricky

strats.name: X-Ray Climb Space Jump
note: X-ray climb until Samus is above the water surface.
To avoid falling out, be careful not to turn left except while holding X-ray.
From a standing position facing left, hold left and immediately jump, then use Space Jump to reach the ledge.
Alternatively, from a standing position facing right, do a turn-around spin jump, waiting to jump until part way through the turn-around animation (otherwise Samus will bonk inside the wall)

It is also possible to climb lower, with Samus' feet still in the water; in this case, the turn-around animation is slower, providing a larger window to jump, though in this case either a wall jump or a Space Jump water escape may be needed.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
strats.note: Jump from the raised alcove.  A down grab can help.

strats.name: Suitless Springball
strats.note: Start the jump from the raised alcove.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to do a mid-air morph through the morph tunnel.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley Springball Spike Boost
strats.note: When the Cacatac on the ground fires a spike, perform a  springball Jump to break the waterline and then hit the spike for extra height.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley HiJumpless Double SpringBall Jump and Bomb-Grapple-Jump
note: 1) Crouch jump and then SpringBall jump.
2) Bomb-Grapple-Jump using the distant Cacatac who is above the water.
3) SpringBall jump again just as Samus exits the water.

strats.name: Cacatac Boost
note: Jump into the ceiling Cacatac and damage boost onto the platform between spike pits.
Use IFrames to cross the second set of spikes.

strats.name: Suitless HiJump
devNote: The first spike pit on the right is considered unavoidable, as if the player has Gravity and HiJump, the jump is quite tricky.
In that scenario, the player will hit the spikes or need the strat with canDisableEquipment.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless Jump
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.

strats.name: Suitless Springball
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.
devNote: This strat is only used if the player doesn't have canCarefulJump, because otherwise the Suitless Bootless strat will be used,
because canSpringBallJumpMidAir requires canDisableEquipment.

strats.name: Suitless Bootless
strats.note: This can be done by turning off Gravity and HiJump to jump over both spike pits.

strats.name: Get Hit By Zoa
strats.note: Lure the Zoas. Jump so that they start moving horizontally higher, use spin jumps to move horizontally faster while keeping them on screen.

farmCycles.name: Zoa Power Beam spam
farmCycles.note: Doable without getting in the sand here

farmCycles.name: Zoa Power Beam spam
farmCycles.note: Doable without getting in the sand here, as long as you can reach the node.

farmCycles.name: Zoa Power Beam spam
farmCycles.note: Doable without getting in the sand here, as long as you can reach the node.

to.devNote: This link refers specifically to crossing on frozen enemies.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The expectation is to fall down the left side of the sand entrance.

to.devNote: This link refers specifically to crossing on frozen enemies.

nodes.name: West Aqueduct Quicksand Room Top Sand Entrance (From Aqueduct Left)
West Aqueduct Quicksand Room Bottom Sand Exit (to West Sand Hole)
East Aqueduct Quicksand Room Top Sand Entrance (from Aqueduct Right)
East Aqueduct Quicksand Room Bottom Sand Exit (to East Sand Hole)
East Sand Hole Top Sand Entrance (From East Aqueduct Quicksand Room)
East Sand Hole Bottom Sand Exit (to East Sand Hall)
Missile (right Maridia sand pit room)
Power Bomb (right Maridia sand pit room)

strats.name: Suitless
strats.note: It's possible to get out of the sand suitless and without HiJump after falling from the chute, by hugging the left side and moving quickly.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Jump out of the sand before Shinesparking.

strats.name: Double Springball Jump
strats.note: Perform a double springball jump with the first jump being a bounce on the sand.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Underwater Walljumps
strats.note: Jump off the sand and use Underwater Walljumps to enter the maze leading to the Power Bomb location.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Insane Walljump Morph
strats.note: Walljump up and instant morph with exact timing and positioning so as to enter the Power Bomb location through the maze's exit.

strats.name: East Sand Hole Sandfall Bounce to Power Bombs
note: By using the sandfall physics, it is possible to springballjump to the Maridia Power Bomb location without Gravity or HiJump.
This requires a very precise spinjump into the sandfall which also exits the sandfall, after being pushed down, with more height than a regular jump.
It is very easy to fall into the sand and be unable to escape.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: The shinespark must be performed near the upper ledge, and not inside the sandfall.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Through Crumbles
strats.note: IBJ or Spring Ball Bomb Jump through two sets of Crumble Blocks.
strats.devNote: FIXME Add a morphless double spring ball jump.

nodes.name: West Sand Hole Top Sand Entrance (from West Aqueduct Quicksand Room)
West Sand Hole Bottom Sand Exit (to West Sand Hall)
Missile (left Maridia sand pit room)
Reserve Tank, Maridia
West Sand Hole Junction (Midway Point)
West Sand Hole Top Junction
nodes.note: Positioned in a tunnel above 5. You actually have to go back to 5 to move between the left and right portions of this junction, but access both ways has the same requirements.

nodes.name: West Sand Hole Junction (Bottom Middle)
nodes.note: Positioned below 5, next to the crumble blocks.

strats.name: Avoid Sand
strats.note: Land on the solid ground to the right and space jump or Springball over the sand.

strats.name: Gravity In Sand
strats.note: Gravity with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Suitless Wall Jump Break Free
note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.  Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.
Perform several wall jumps to climb up to the water level, then precise wall jumps to break free.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Space Wall Climb
strats.note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region. Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.

strats.name: Suitless Dual Jump Assist
note: HiJump with a good jump from the sand can reach the Solid Rock Maze region.  Use the sandfall if Samus gets stuck in the sand.
Bouncing on the sand as springball can reach the above maze by altering Samus' fall height, like by bouncing under the solid ledge before trying to jump up.
devNote: Jumping through the sandfall is failable enough to require canPlayInSand
This is not a traditional max height spring ball jump, as it requires HiJump and crosses the waterline, but it requires similar inputs and precision.

strats.name: Shinespark
note: Break the shot block before reaching the sand and then shinespark up.
Samus cannot shinespark after unmorphing until she touches the sand and this can be used to shoot upwards without sparking.
A diagonal ShineSpark will most likely not have any horizontal movement when performed from the sand.

strats.name: G-Mode Through Crumbles from the Left
note: Get to the left side of the room while avoiding the hole in the ground, jump up through the Morph tunnel.
Jump up to the ledge with either Gravity, HiJump and a Crouch Jump Down Grab, or a maximum height Spring Ball Jump.

strats.name: Gravity
strats.note: Jump and morph directly into the morph tunnel.  Using a walljump can help make the jump safer.

strats.name: Gravity with Springball
strats.note: Springball bounce on top of the crumble blocks.  Use either a bomb or HiJump to gain a little bit of extra height.
strats.devNote: The tech requirement is `catching yourself on an aerial bomb` which is what canJumpIntoIBJ adds to canIBJ.  Only one bomb or powerbomb is needed.

strats.name: Suitless Mid Air Morph
strats.note: Escape the water with either HiJump or SpaceJump, then carefully jump and morph into the tunnel.

strats.name: West Sand Hole Bootless Suitless IBJ
strats.note: Jump off of the crumble blocks consecutively while placing a bomb on the water line and convert that into an IBJ to climb the West Sand Hole maze.

rooms.name: Toilet Bowl

nodes.name: Toilet Bowl Top Door (to Plasma Spark)
Toilet Bowl Bottom Door (to Oasis)

rooms.note: This is the vertical pipe that connects Plasma Spark Room and Oasis. Visually it looks like a portion of Aqueduct and Botwoon Hallway (and surroundings).
devNote: There are no links because Samus can't move freely between the nodes.
Traversal through the room happens via each node's spawnAt property, placing Samus at the other end of the room with no option but to leave.
